Free Grade Calculator 2025 - Calculate Test Scores & Final Grades

Calculate your test scores, final grades, and GPA. Track academic progress, plan your studies, and achieve your grade goals with our comprehensive grade calculator.

How to Use Our Grade Calculator

  1. Enter Assignment Details: Input assignment names, points possible, and points earned
  2. Set Weight Categories: Choose homework, tests, projects, and final exam weights
  3. Add Multiple Assignments: Include all your graded work for the semester
  4. View Results: See your current grade and what you need to pass
  5. Plan Ahead: Calculate what scores you need on remaining assignments

Grade Calculation Formula

Your final grade is calculated using:

Final Grade = Σ (Assignment Grade × Weight) ÷ Total Weight

Where: Assignment Grade = Points Earned ÷ Points Possible

Weighted categories ensure different assignment types contribute appropriately to your final grade.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I calculate my current grade?

Add up all your points earned, divide by total points possible, then multiply by 100. For weighted grades, multiply each category grade by its weight percentage, then sum the results.

What's the difference between weighted and unweighted grades?

Unweighted grades treat all assignments equally. Weighted grades give different importance to different assignment types (e.g., tests worth 40%, homework worth 20%, final exam worth 40%).

How can I improve my grade if it's low?

Focus on high-weight assignments first, attend office hours, form study groups, and prioritize assignments with the most impact on your final grade. Use our calculator to identify which assignments matter most.

What grade do I need on the final to pass?

Use our calculator to determine the minimum grade needed on remaining assignments. Input your current grade and see what you need to achieve your target final grade.

How do I handle extra credit assignments?

Extra credit can boost your grade, but it's typically added to your total points rather than replacing poor grades. Check with your instructor about how extra credit is calculated in your course.

Grade Calculator Features

  • Weighted Calculations: Handle complex grading systems with multiple categories
  • Grade Planning: Calculate what scores you need to reach your goals
  • Multiple Assignments: Track unlimited assignments and their impact
  • Grade Scenarios: Compare different grade outcomes and strategies

Academic Success Tips

  • Check your grades regularly to stay on track
  • Focus on high-weight assignments that impact your grade most
  • Communicate with instructors about grading policies and expectations
  • Use the calculator to plan your study time effectively
  • Set realistic grade goals based on your abilities and workload
  • Don't wait until the end of the semester to check your progress
  • Consider the impact of each assignment on your final grade
  • Use grade calculations to motivate yourself and stay focused
